refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The method creates an XMLType instance from src XML entity. If parameter src is not an XML entity then it is converted to it via internal call of xtree_doc() or xml_tree_doc(). A schema may be associated with an XML entity by passing its URI as schema_uri; this schema can be used later to validate the structure of the document.

refsect2.title: src
refsect2.para: An XML entity or a value that can be converted to an XML entity.

refsect2.title: schema_uri
refsect2.para: An URI of the schema of the document. The default is NULL to make result non-schema based.

refsect2.title: validated
refsect2.para: An integer flag that indicates if the document is already validated against the schema of the document (this is to avoid redundant validations). The default is 0.

refsect2.title: wellformed
refsect2.para: This parameter is unused and is listed solely for compatibility.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: The method returns a new instance of XMLType.

example.title: Simple Use
example.screen:
create table XMLTYPE_TEST (I integer primary key, XMLVAL long xml)
Done. -- 00000 msec.
insert into XMLTYPE_TEST values (1, XMLType('<emp><empno>221</empno><ename>John</ename></emp>'))
Done. -- 00000 msec.
insert into XMLTYPE_TEST values (2, XMLType('<po><pono>331</pono><poname>PO_1</poname></po>'))
Done. -- 00000 msec.
select e.XMLVAL.extract ('//empno/text()').getNumVal() as EMPNO from XMLTYPE_TEST as e where e.XMLVAL.existsNode('/emp/empno') = 1 EMPNO DECIMAL _______________________________________________________________________________
221
1 Rows. -- 00000 msec.
